text: The North-Western Chord is an arterial road in Moscow which is a part of Moscow Chord Ring. Its length is about 30 km. It was fully opened on 29 November, 2019, along with the opening of the New Karamyshevsky Bridge. == Gallery == Осмотр хода строительства станции «Карамышевская» БКЛ (октябрь 2019) 1.jpg|The was the last unfinished section of the North-Western Chord and was opened in 2019. Открытие нового Карамышевского моста в составе последнего участка СЗХ.jpg|On the photo, Narodnogo Opolcheniya Street and Karamyshevskaya Embankment are in the lower level, beneath the North-Western Chord. Narodnogo Opolcheniya street tunnel.jpg|Moscow’s first double-deck tunnel was opened in 2016 as part of the built section of the North-Western Chord. Строительство станции БКЛ «Улица Народного Ополчения» (август 2020) (24).jpeg|An interchange of Krasnopresnensky Prospekt and the North-Western Chord (passes through a tunnel). Осмотр хода строительства станции «Карамышевская» БКЛ (октябрь 2019) 2.jpg|The North-Eastern Chord passes Mnyovnikovskaya foodplain. == See also == * North-Eastern Chord * South-Eastern Chord == References == Category:Roads in Moscow
title: North-Western Chord
